programme.title: CSI: Miami
CSI: Miami
programme.desc:
CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as good as original, but still worth watching.","reviewBody":"Spin-off shows are very strange television projects. In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. Zuiker"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"CSI: Miami: Complete Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320379929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for CSI: Miami - Complete Season 08"}}</script><metacontent="

In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. Series following an elite team of police forensic evidence investigation experts as they work their cases in Las Vegas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0247082/","name":"CSI: Crime Scene Investigation","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRlZjFmNTktYzg0ZC00OWJlLWJlN2EtOGQ1OTRiOTFiMWE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTA4NzY1MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Series following an elite team of police forensic evidence investigation experts as they work their cases in Las Vegas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0247082/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kidcurry1967"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Outstanding!!!","reviewBody":"C.S.I. is the best new show of the 2000 season! William L. Petersen is the coolest of the cool as Gil Grissom. I've followed his career since I first saw him in To Live and Die in L.A. He's an amazing actor and he heads up a cast of amazing actors as well. This show really keeps you on the edge of your seat as the investigators literally take a crime scene that appears to leave them with nothing to go on. programme.title: CSI: Miami
CSI: Miami
programme.desc:
CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as good as original, but still worth watching.","reviewBody":"Spin-off shows are very strange television projects. In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. Zuiker"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"CSI: Miami: Complete Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320379929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for CSI: Miami - Complete Season 08"}}</script><metacontent="

Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. programme.title: CSI: Miami
CSI: Miami
programme.desc:
CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as good as original, but still worth watching.","reviewBody":"Spin-off shows are very strange television projects. In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. Zuiker"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"CSI: Miami: Complete Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320379929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for CSI: Miami - Complete Season 08"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: No deserto, um grupo de vampiros descobre o túmulo de Drácula e ressuscita-o para que ele os ajude a capturar Blade. Já Blade é agora um homem procurado pelo FBI, e tem de juntar forças a um bando de caçadores de vampiros para enfrentar o seu mais perigoso inimigo até à data.

programme.desc: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation: Created by Anthony E. Zuiker. With George Eads, Eric Szmanda, Robert David Hall, Paul Guilfoyle. Series following an elite team of police forensic evidence investigation experts as they work their cases in Las Vegas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0247082/","name":"CSI: Crime Scene Investigation","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRlZjFmNTktYzg0ZC00OWJlLWJlN2EtOGQ1OTRiOTFiMWE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTA4NzY1MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Series following an elite team of police forensic evidence investigation experts as they work their cases in Las Vegas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0247082/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kidcurry1967"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Outstanding!!!","reviewBody":"C.S.I. is the best new show of the 2000 season! William L. Petersen is the coolest of the cool as Gil Grissom. I've followed his career since I first saw him in To Live and Die in L.A. He's an amazing actor and he heads up a cast of amazing actors as well. This show really keeps you on the edge of your seat as the investigators literally take a crime scene that appears to leave them with nothing to go on. The investigators take nothing and turn it into something amazing as each crime is solved right in front of you and you as the viewer, never see it coming! Wow! I hope this is one show CBS will pick up year after year!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":81434,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2000-10-06","keywords":"crime scene investigation,las vegas nevada,crime lab,police,detective","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000401/","name":"Laurence Fishburne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001339/","name":"Marg Helgenberger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0247040/","name":"George Eads"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. programme.title: CSI: Miami
CSI: Miami
programme.desc:
CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as good as original, but still worth watching.","reviewBody":"Spin-off shows are very strange television projects. In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. Zuiker"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"CSI: Miami: Complete Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320379929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for CSI: Miami - Complete Season 08"}}</script><metacontent="

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. CSI: Miami
programme.desc:
CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as good as original, but still worth watching.","reviewBody":"Spin-off shows are very strange television projects. In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. programme.title: CSI: Miami
CSI: Miami
programme.desc:
CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as good as original, but still worth watching.","reviewBody":"Spin-off shows are very strange television projects. In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. Zuiker"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"CSI: Miami: Complete Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320379929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for CSI: Miami - Complete Season 08"}}</script><metacontent="

In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. Zuiker"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"CSI: Miami: Complete Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320379929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for CSI: Miami - Complete Season 08"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation: Created by Anthony E. Zuiker. With George Eads, Eric Szmanda, Robert David Hall, Paul Guilfoyle. Series following an elite team of police forensic evidence investigation experts as they work their cases in Las Vegas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0247082/","name":"CSI: Crime Scene Investigation","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRlZjFmNTktYzg0ZC00OWJlLWJlN2EtOGQ1OTRiOTFiMWE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTA4NzY1MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Series following an elite team of police forensic evidence investigation experts as they work their cases in Las Vegas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0247082/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kidcurry1967"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Outstanding!!!","reviewBody":"C.S.I. is the best new show of the 2000 season! William L. Petersen is the coolest of the cool as Gil Grissom. I've followed his career since I first saw him in To Live and Die in L.A. He's an amazing actor and he heads up a cast of amazing actors as well. This show really keeps you on the edge of your seat as the investigators literally take a crime scene that appears to leave them with nothing to go on. The investigators take nothing and turn it into something amazing as each crime is solved right in front of you and you as the viewer, never see it coming! Wow! I hope this is one show CBS will pick up year after year!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":81434,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2000-10-06","keywords":"crime scene investigation,las vegas nevada,crime lab,police,detective","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000401/","name":"Laurence Fishburne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001339/","name":"Marg Helgenberger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0247040/","name":"George Eads"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. programme.desc:
CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as good as original, but still worth watching.","reviewBody":"Spin-off shows are very strange television projects. In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. Zuiker"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"CSI: Miami: Complete Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320379929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU1NzhhNjItMzQ5ZC00YmFmLWEwMmYtMWVlMjFkNjdkZGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for CSI: Miami - Complete Season 08"}}</script><metacontent="

CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as good as original, but still worth watching.","reviewBody":"Spin-off shows are very strange television projects. In some cases they work, like Angel which has become a show of its own. On the other hand the Star Trek spin-offs (more so the later ones) have becoming mere clones of the show they have spawned from. It is difficult to make it work. You can try and be different and the fan base from the originating show could hate you. Be too similar and the counter effect it that many will call it nothing but a clone. While CSI:Miami is more or less the same show as CSI:Crime Scene Investigation it is still a series that is well worth watching and most of it is down to the reasons that the originating series was worth watching. Fantastic writing, feature film production values and a good cast. While in Crime Scene Investigation the casting is first class here were are merely in good territory. The cast here don't seem to share the same chemistry as Grissom and friends, although whether or not this is deliberate I'm not sure.

With regards to casting what they do have in common is a superb central male lead. David Caruso is a fine actor, was so in the first season of NYPD Blue. Here he is incredible. Unlike Grissom, Horatio Crane (the best name ever for the main character in a television show) is more speculative, he will be more open to hunches than just considering the evidence. The manner in which is delivers his dialog is controlled mannered. If Grissom is the Fox Mulder of CSI, then Crane is undoubtedly the Frank Black. The supporting actors themselves are very good. Kim Delaney was watchable if a little too glossy while former West Wing actress Emily Procter once again brings a wealth of quirky charm that she likewise did with Ainsley in the White House drama.

Of course the biggest change here is the location. Instead of the bright lights of Las Vegas we have the sun shine of Miami. Ironically whereas Crime Scene Investigation would be predominantly set during night time, Miami is set more in the day light hours and with it comes a higher level of violence. In Ireland the channel that broadcasts the show frequently put out a warning before hand, something that never befalls the originating series. What we get here are episodes involving body parts falling of out dead sharks, scenes of autopsies that are more graphic and stories that are slightly more darker (the show itself is broadcast at 10pm in America).

While the show is no Angel it isn't Star Trek:Voyager either. It is hugely entertaining and the stories are frequently entertaining and well produced. What it lacks though is the warmness of the Las Vegas team. Horatio, in the same way as Frank Black, is less emotional and more controlled over his thoughts, whereas the Las Vegas equivalent would be putting heart and soul into the cases they were fighting for. In saying that the show is still worth watching and is perhaps the first step in what is looking like a growing franchise."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. programme.title: Os Mistérios da Nova Miss Fisher
Crimes Perfeitos: Alta Tensão
programme.desc: Para se vingar do homem que o enviou para a prisão, Fabio Magrini mata-o à distância, usando um robô pequeno e controlado de forma remota. Isto dá-lhe um álibi inquestionável. Quando Roche descobre que o apartamento arrendado por Magrini tem vista para o cenário do crime, fica muito desconfiado.

programme.title: Crimes Perfeitos: Estrela Amaldiçoada
programme.desc: A vingança é um prato que se serve frio. Por isso, quando o chef David Pasquier descobre que a sua mulher o traiu, engendra um plano para a matar. O chef maquiavélico tenta incriminar o seu cunhado. Mas Claire Moreno está convencida que David cometeu um homicídio digno de três estrelas Michelin...

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.sub-title: The Man With The Golden Gun

programme.title: Mistério No Moulin Rouge
programme.desc: Paris, 1892. Diane vai até Paris em busca da irmã desaparecida e pretende tornar-se bailarina do Moulin Rouge. Ao entrar no mundo da elite, acaba por desvendar uma série de homicídios da qual poderá ser a próxima vítima.

programme.title: The Baby Proposal
programme.desc: Layla Bennett é a coapresentadora do Wake Up Chicago. Ao seu lado, Derek Dray, o seu colega charmoso. Ela gosta de ser espontânea e improvisar em direto, enquanto ele prefere cingir-se ao guião. Quando recebem a tarefa de tomar conta de um bebé juntos, é o seu pior pesadelo...

programme.title: Happily Never After
programme.desc: Kate, uma autora de livros sobre crimes, acredita que os dias de coautora de livros infantis com o ex-namorado chegaram ao fim, até que o editor pede uma sequela. Quando surgem problemas durante o processo criativo, Kate e Josh decidem reviver o passado, o que faz com que se apaixonem novamente.

programme.title: Sisters of The Groom
programme.desc: Jason convence a sua vizinha Sarah a fingir ser sua namorada durante o casamento do irmão, mas as suas irmãs metediças descobrem que algo estranho se passa.

programme.title: Love is a Piece of Cake
programme.desc: Jessie Dale é a terceira geração a trabalhar na padaria que lhe é mais preciosa do que qualquer outra coisa. Quando promotores imobiliários ameaçam comprar o edifício e forçá-la a sair, terá de fazer tudo o que pode para salvar a padaria, ao mesmo tempo que nasce um romance com o irmão do cliente.

programme.title: BFF Bride
programme.desc: Quando Ted fica noivo da malvada do secundário e pede a Jess, a sua melhor amiga de infância, para planear o casamento, as coisas complicam-se. Os verdadeiros sentimentos dela por Ted não param de vir ao de cima.

programme.title: Love At First Flight
programme.desc: Quando Lily Summers, uma designer de interiores, volta à terra Natal para ajudar a sua tia Maggie a gerir um alojamento local perto da marina, conhece Marcus. Este é um piloto cujo trabalho de entrega de cães de resgate ajuda Lily a descobrir que a nossa casa é mesmo onde mora o coração.

programme.title: A Wish Come True
programme.desc: Na noite do seu 30º aniversário, Lindsay Corwin pede que todos os seus desejos de aniversários passados se tornem realidade.

programme.title: Secret Summer
programme.desc: Quando Rachel é enviada para uma cidade pequena, espera conseguir terminar a tarefa rapidamente para voltar a Nova Iorque. Porém, não estava a contar com Jake, um autor em pesquisa para um novo livro. Mas Rachel não é a única visita inesperada para Jake, que é chamado a tomar conta dos sobrinhos.

programme.title: The Wedding Do Over
programme.desc: Abby, uma organizadora de casamentos, especializa-se em tratar de cerimónias que correram mal. Mas quando é forçada a trabalhar com o ex-noivo, começa a questionar-se se a relação dos dois era mesmo o desastre que ela recorda.

programme.title: My Birthday Boyfriend
programme.desc: Callie Fitzgerald está farta que a família tente arranjar-lhe namorado e questione o facto de estar solteira. Por isso, está determinada a encontrar um namorado a fingir para a sua festa de 35 anos só para a família a deixar em paz. O que ela não esperava era apaixonar-se por ele de verdade...

programme.title: Brimming With Love
programme.desc: Allie está a escrever um artigo sobre Sam, o proprietário de um café que tem a fama de fazer "arranjinhos". Sem grande fé, Allie concorda que Sam lhe arranje um potencial namorado. Mas, durante o processo, as diferenças que descobrem ter entre eles fazem com que descubram que podem ser almas gémeas.

programme.title: Love at Sunset Terrace
programme.desc: Sophie Carter viaja para uma pequena cidade costeira, onde pernoita num Airbnb pertencente a um homem viúvo com uma filha pequena. Com um pequeno "empurrão" da menina, Sophie e Michael começam, inesperadamente, a apaixonar-se e Sophie tem de decidir entre voltar a casa e seguir o seu coração.

programme.title: The Resident
The Resident
programme.desc: The Resident: Created by Amy Holden Jones, Hayley Schore, Roshan Sethi. With Matt Czuchry, Manish Dayal, Bruce Greenwood, Emily VanCamp. A group of doctors at Chastain Memorial Hospital face personal and professional challenges on a daily basis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6483832/","name":"The Resident","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc1MmE1NGYtMzFlYS00YTNmLThjNmEtMjQ5NzY4NmJkZTIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODkxMzcxOTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of doctors at Chastain Memorial Hospital face personal and professional challenges on a daily basis.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6483832/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jmrx-242-218325"},"dateCreated":"2018-03-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Develops well as it continues","reviewBody":"I don't even like medical dramas, and I like this one. Many of the reviews here are from those who only watched the pilot, which I admit showed a rather surface-level power clash of the two main characters. But as the show has gone on (I just finished S1 E6), it has gotten increasingly interesting and much smoother to watch. I mainly started watching because of Matt Cuzchry, and he holds down the cast with a strong performance every episode. I am fascinated with their exploration of corruption in hospitals (although I think it is exaggerated at times, but what drama isn't?!), and they do weave that theme into every episode. \n\nGood overall mix of medical drama, a romance, and individual character stories that have gotten more complex and real. A group of doctors at Chastain Memorial Hospital face personal and professional challenges on a daily basis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6483832/","name":"The Resident","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc1MmE1NGYtMzFlYS00YTNmLThjNmEtMjQ5NzY4NmJkZTIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODkxMzcxOTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of doctors at Chastain Memorial Hospital face personal and professional challenges on a daily basis.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6483832/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jmrx-242-218325","dateCreated":"2018-03-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Develops well as it continues","reviewBody":"I don't even like medical dramas, and I like this one. Many of the reviews here are from those who only watched the pilot, which I admit showed a rather surface-level power clash of the two main characters. But as the show has gone on (I just finished S1 E6), it has gotten increasingly interesting and much smoother to watch. I mainly started watching because of Matt Cuzchry, and he holds down the cast with a strong performance every episode. I am fascinated with their exploration of corruption in hospitals (although I think it is exaggerated at times, but what drama isn't?!), and they do weave that theme into every episode. \n\nGood overall mix of medical drama, a romance, and individual character stories that have gotten more complex and real. programme.title: Um Ritmo Perfeito 3
programme.desc: Passada a euforia do Campeonato Mundial, as Bellas separam-se e começam a perceber que não existem perspetivas de trabalho para quem faz música com as cordas vocais. Mas quando surge a oportunidade de uma digressão internacional, elas juntam-se outra vez.

programme.title: Autumn In The Vineyard
programme.desc: Quando Frankie Baldwin e Nate Deluca têm ambos direito à propriedade de Sorrento Farm, são forçados a dividir a vinha a meio. Trabalham os campos lado a lado para levar a colheita à competição do Melhor Vinho no Festival Anual da Colheita de Outono. Só que a rivalidade não ficará resolvida ali...

programme.title: Clínica Privada
programme.sub-title: Good Fries Are Hard To Come By

programme.title: Sisters of The Groom
programme.desc: Jason convence a sua vizinha Sarah a fingir ser sua namorada durante o casamento do irmão, mas as suas irmãs metediças descobrem que algo estranho se passa.

programme.title: Tomboy
programme.desc: Tori sempre foi uma maria-rapaz. Desde a sua recente tentativa de se tornar mais feminina que se vê dividida entre um homem que se apaixonou pela sua feminilidade e um amigo que a adora pelo que sempre foi.

programme.title: The Baby Proposal
programme.desc: Layla Bennett é a coapresentadora do Wake Up Chicago. Ao seu lado, Derek Dray, o seu colega charmoso. Ela gosta de ser espontânea e improvisar em direto, enquanto ele prefere cingir-se ao guião. Quando recebem a tarefa de tomar conta de um bebé juntos, é o seu pior pesadelo...

programme.title: Happily Never After
programme.desc: Kate, uma autora de livros sobre crimes, acredita que os dias de coautora de livros infantis com o ex-namorado chegaram ao fim, até que o editor pede uma sequela. Quando surgem problemas durante o processo criativo, Kate e Josh decidem reviver o passado, o que faz com que se apaixonem novamente.

programme.title: Love is a Piece of Cake
programme.desc: Jessie Dale é a terceira geração a trabalhar na padaria que lhe é mais preciosa do que qualquer outra coisa. Quando promotores imobiliários ameaçam comprar o edifício e forçá-la a sair, terá de fazer tudo o que pode para salvar a padaria, ao mesmo tempo que nasce um romance com o irmão do cliente.

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
Anatomia de Grey
programme.desc: Grey's Anatomy: Created by Shonda Rhimes. With Ellen Pompeo, Chandra Wilson, James Pickens Jr., Justin Chambers. A drama centered on the personal and professional lives of five surgical interns and their supervisors." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0413573/","name":"Grey's Anatomy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA2Mjk0N2MtNGY0Mi00ZWFjLTkxODEtZDFjNDg4ZDliMGVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzAzNTY3MDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drama centered on the personal and professional lives of five surgical interns and their supervisors.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0413573/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"HaloFive00"},"dateCreated":"2006-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Addictive show","reviewBody":"Grey's Anatomy is a surprisingly addictive show. The plot lines are an interesting blend of soap opera, drama, and comedy--it's not really like anything else, but at the same time, it occasionally feels pedestrian. However, it's very well done--good writing, great acting, and well directed. \n\nSandra Oh stands out for her comic timing, but the entire cast is superb. It's not as grave as ER, but is just as compelling. Also, it's a little more accessible than ER and some of the more serious medical dramas. The show is definitely worth catching--if you can't watch it when it airs, TiVo it or rent the first season DVD. It's well worth the time spent! It's great for marathon viewings!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":281866,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2005-03-27","keywords":"surgeon,hospital,lesbian,work romance,surgery","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0690186/","name":"Ellen Pompeo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933156/","name":"Chandra Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0681782/","name":"James Pickens Jr."}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0170849/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0085751/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067205/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0722274/","name":"Shonda Rhimes"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 12 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi17412889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NjQyOTkzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI5NTY4NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NjQyOTkzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI5NTY4NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Season 12 of Grey's Anatomy from ABC."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Wedding Do Over
programme.desc: Abby, uma organizadora de casamentos, especializa-se em tratar de cerimónias que correram mal. Mas quando é forçada a trabalhar com o ex-noivo, começa a questionar-se se a relação dos dois era mesmo o desastre que ela recorda.

programme.title: Woman of The House
programme.desc: Uma ex-universitária aceita um trabalho como governanta na sua antiga residência, que descobre estar em decadência. Com ajuda do Diretor de Estudantes, Sarah dá uma grande volta na residência antes que esta seja excluída do "campus" e prova ser uma influência positiva sobre as estudantes.

programme.title: A Wish Come True
programme.desc: Na noite do seu 30º aniversário, Lindsay Corwin pede que todos os seus desejos de aniversários passados se tornem realidade.

programme.title: Secret Summer
programme.desc: Quando Rachel é enviada para uma cidade pequena, espera conseguir terminar a tarefa rapidamente para voltar a Nova Iorque. Porém, não estava a contar com Jake, um autor em pesquisa para um novo livro. Mas Rachel não é a única visita inesperada para Jake, que é chamado a tomar conta dos sobrinhos.

programme.title: My Birthday Boyfriend
programme.desc: Callie Fitzgerald está farta que a família tente arranjar-lhe namorado e questione o facto de estar solteira. Por isso, está determinada a encontrar um namorado a fingir para a sua festa de 35 anos só para a família a deixar em paz. O que ela não esperava era apaixonar-se por ele de verdade...
